lead_paragraph: Some inside the administration and among national security experts have questioned whether the focus should be more on the Taliban than the Islamic State.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Steps Up Airstrikes Against ISIS After Group Makes Gains in Afghanistan
headline.main: U.S. Steps Up Airstrikes Against ISIS After It Gains Territory in Afghanistan

snippet: Some inside the administration and among national security experts have questioned whether the focus should be more on the Taliban than the Islamic State.
abstract: Military commanders say United States has intensified its bombing campaign against Islamic State militants in Afghanistan, dropping 251 bombs and missiles in January and February and tripling number of strikes compared to same period in 2015; campaign, coming after Pres Obama's announced end to Afghanistan War and amid growing concern over Taliban, has touched off debate over appropriate response to threat posed by Islamic State.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
